channelDescription: Khan Academy offers practice exercises, instructional videos, and a personalized learning dashboard that empower learners to study at their own pace in and outside of the classroom.
Kurzgesagt creates animated educational content covering topics like science, technology, politics, and philosophy.
Vsauce features videos on scientific, psychological, mathematical, and philosophical topics, as well as gaming, technology, and popular culture.
Veritasium is a channel of science and engineering videos featuring experiments, expert interviews, cool demos, and discussions with the public about everything science-related.
SmarterEveryDay explores the world using science, featuring experiments and explanations to help viewers learn something new every day.
Former NASA engineer. Current CrunchLabs founder and friend of science.
Mariah Elizabeth is an arts and crafts channel focusing on DIY squishies, art, and creative projects.
MKBHD is a technology-focused channel providing reviews, interviews, and discussions about the latest in tech.
TED-Ed is TED's youth and education initiative, offering animated educational videos across a wide range of subjects.
TED is a nonprofit devoted to spreading ideas, usually in the form of short, powerful talks (18 minutes or less).
CrashCourse offers high-quality educational videos on a variety of subjects, including history, science, economics, and more.
AsapSCIENCE provides fun and informative videos that answer many of life's everyday questions with science.
MinutePhysics offers cool physics and other sweet science videos, all in a minute.
Numberphile features videos about numbers and mathematics, exploring topics from the profound to the quirky.
Kurzgesagt creates animated educational content covering topics like science, technology, politics, and philosophy.
Vsauce features videos on scientific, psychological, mathematical, and philosophical topics, as well as gaming, technology, and popular culture.
Veritasium is a channel of science and engineering videos featuring experiments, expert interviews, cool demos, and discussions with the public about everything science-related.

The most fun you can (legally) have with a robot.

NHRL is the National Havoc Robot League. The biggest and most accessible robot combat league in the world.

Home of the 3lb, 12lb and 30lb World Championships.
